title: A bill to require assessment of the impact on small business concerns of rules relating to internal controls, and for other purposes.
content: Small Business Regulatory Review Act of 2007 - Requires the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), before approving any final rule of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board , to conduct and complete a regulatory flexibility analysis of such rule. Requires the SEC to publish the small business compliance guide on the same date as the publication of the final rule issued to carry out a provision of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act concerning management of internal controls for financial reporting. Directs the Comptroller General to conduct an assessment of the impact on small businesses of such rules.
